channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Cette bonne barre de son Samsung à moins de 100 € est le deal parfait pour améliorer le son d’un TV sans se ruiner
item.description: Améliorez le son de votre téléviseur pour pas cher avec la Samsung HW-B460F. Elle bénéficie d'une offre de remboursement qui permet de l'obtenir à seulement 99 euros chez Cdiscount.

item.title: Avec cette caméra pensée pour le vlog, Insta360 continue de provoquer DJI
item.description: À l'occasion d'une conférence en Chine, Insta360 a dévoilé sa caméra Luna, un modèle destiné au vlog qui vient directement faire face aux caméras Pocket de DJI.

item.title: US FTC airs concerns over allegations that Apple News suppresses right-wing content
item.description: In a letter to Apple CEO Tim Cook, FTC chair Andrew Ferguson cited reports from Media Research Center, a right-leaning think tank, which accused Apple of excluding right-leaning outlets from the top 20 articles in the Apple News feed.

item.title: Presidents' Day sales 2026: The best early tech deals to shop this week from Apple, Sony, Samsung and others
item.description: You can find a lot of good deals for Presidents’ Day, but to say it’s a tech-deal boon would be an overstatement. The best Presidents’ Day deals are usually on mattresses, appliances and furniture, but you can find some decent tech sales thrown in as well. This year, Presidents’ Day comes right after Valentine’s Day and Super Bowl 2026, which means there are even more chances to save as sales and discounts overlap. If you’re looking for a new streaming device, a fresh iPad or an upgraded vacuum so you can enter the spring-cleaning season properly, we have you covered. These are the best Presid...

item.title: Elon Musk's X Appears to Be Violating US Sanctions by Selling Premium Accounts to Iranian Leaders
item.description: While publicly supporting protesters in Iran, Elon Musk's X appears to have been selling premium accounts to regime officials. Checkmarks were removed from certain accounts after a WIRED inquiry.

item.title: Resident Evil Requiem : votre PC est-il prêt pour le nouveau cauchemar de Capcom ?
item.description: La licence Resident Evil revient bientôt avec un opus attendu de longue date. Découvrez si votre PC est prêt à affronter le nouveau jeu survival-horror ou s'il est temps d'envisager une mise à jour.

item.title: Resident Evil 4 Remake tourne moins bien qu’avant sur PC et on connait le coupable
item.description: Les performances du remake de Resident Evil 4 sur PC sont en baisse depuis quelques temps. On sait maintenant pourquoi.

item.title: La dernière mise à jour de votre iPhone apporte une petite révolution pour les montres connectées
item.description: Avec l'arrivée d'iOS 26.3, les iPhone sont désormais plus facilement utilisables avec les montres connectées de marques tierces grâce au transfert de notifications et à l'appairage à proximité.

item.title: Google Photos va (enfin) simplifier le partage d’images
item.description: Google Photos prépare un bouton « Copier » dans ses options de partage. Pensé pour copier une image vers le presse‑papiers et la coller directement dans les applications de messagerie, cela doit rendre le partage de photos beaucoup plus facile.

item.title: Snapdragon ou Exynos ? On sait enfin ce qui fera tourner le Galaxy S26 Ultra de Samsung
item.description: Qualcomm a quasiment confirmé que le futur Samsung Galaxy S26 Ultra sera propulsé par une puce Snapdragon, prolongeant ainsi le partenariat privilégié entre les deux géants.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S26 et S26 Plus : on sait enfin quelle puce fera tourner les modèles vendus en France
item.description: Samsung s'apprête à dévoiler sa nouvelle gamme Galaxy S26 le 25 février prochain. La version globale du Galaxy S26 Plus vient de faire une apparition remarquée sur Geekbench, confirmant l'intégration d'une puce Exynos 2600.

item.title: Behold, the Samsung Galaxy S26 lineup in glorious leaked photos
item.description: Samsung's Galaxy S26 lineup of phones just leaked. See the photos.

item.title: The Disney+ Hulu bundle is down to only $10 for one month
item.description: You have the best chance to save on streaming services during the holiday shopping season, but throughout the year, the occasional deal pops up that's worth considering. Case in point: this new Disney+ deal. New and eligible returning subscribers can sign up for the Disney+ Hulu bundle (with ads) for $10 for one month of access. That's $3 off the usual price of the bundle for one month, and more than 58 percent off if you consider the cost of each service individually (Disney+ at $12 per month and, separately, Hulu also at $12 per month). We'd be remiss if we didn't mention that this isn't qui...

item.title: Apple fixes dangerous zero-day flaw affecting macOS, iOS and more - update now to avoid 'extremely sophisticated attack'
item.description: Bug was used in an "extremely sophisticated attack" against "specific individuals" using Apple devices.

item.title: Amazon’s Send to Alexa Plus makes the Kindle Scribe feel more like a productivity device
item.description: Amazon's rolling out a new "Send to Alexa Plus" feature to the latest Kindle Scribe and Kindle Scribe Colorsoft owners starting February 12. The feature lets you send your notes or documents to Amazon's AI-powered Alexa Plus assistant, which can then summarize them, turn them into to-do lists, calendar events, or reminders, as well as […]

item.title: Une arnaque bancaire frappe les boutiques PrestaShop, un « script malveillant » vole vos « informations de paiement »
item.description: Une arnaque bancaire redoutable s'est propagée sur des boutiques PrestaShop. Un script malveillant est en effet parvenu à voler les coordonnées bancaires des clients en remplaçant les boutons de paiement légitimes par des formulaires frauduleux.

item.title: 5 things to know about Lockdown Mode, iPhone’s security feature
item.description: A recent incident surrounding a reporter’s device has put this little-known iPhone feature in the spotlight. A little known security feature on iPhones is in the spotlight after it stymied efforts by U.S. federal authorities to search devices seized from a reporter.Apple’s Lockdown Mode recently prevented FBI agents from getting into Washington Post reporter Hannah Natanson’s iPhone.Agents seized the phone, as well as two MacBooks and other electronic devices, when they searched Natanson’s home last month as part of an investigation into a Pentagon contractor accused of illegally handling clas...

item.title: Eclipse backs all-EV marketplace Ever in $31M funding round
item.description: The San Francisco-based startup says its AI-first approach has allowed it to scale faster.

item.title: ‘Spider-Man: Brand New Day’ Could Bring Back Even More Familiar Faces
item.description: Plus, Superman could have a surprising part in 'Supergirl'.

item.title: How to Choose the Right TV in 2026 (and a Few We Like)
item.description: How many ports do you need? What does 4K UHD even mean? What's RGB LED? Here’s everything you need to know.

item.title: Pebble Beach Pro-Am 2026 live stream: how to watch PGA Tour golf online, TV channels, free options
item.description: All the ways to watch Pebble Beach Pro-Am 2026 live streams online from anywhere, as Rory McIlroy attempts to defend his title against a stacked field.

item.title: Amazon's Send to Alexa+ feature arrives on Kindle Scribe and Scribe Colorsoft
item.description: Amazon is launching a feature that will add a new artificial intelligence layer to its writing tablets. "Send to Alexa+" is rolling out to the current generation of Kindle Scribe and Kindle Scribe Colorsoft devices. This concept was announced when Amazon first debuted the Kindle Scribe Colorsoft last fall, but the company said that the feature wouldn't be available until this year.As the name implies, “Send to Alexa+” lets users share their notebooks and documents from their supported Kindle with the Alexa+ AI assistant, making their information accessible on other Amazon platforms, including ...

item.title: NVIDIA's GeForce Now app lands on Amazon Fire TV sticks
item.description: NVIDIA's cloud gaming service, GeForce Now, has expanded to another platform. Starting today, folks with select Amazon Fire TV sticks can install a native GeForce Now app. While it was already possible to access GeForce Now through the Fire TV platform, you won't necessarily need to sideload an Android app to do so anymore.At the outset, the new app is compatible with the second-gen Fire TV Stick 4K Plus and second-gen Fire TV Stick 4K Max (running Fire OS 8.1.6.0 and later). It also works with the original Fire TV Stick 4K Max if you're running Fire OS 7.7.1.1 or later. On the Fire TV platfor...

item.title: Sweethearts has the most valuable real estate of all Valentine’s Day candy
item.description: Thank the Sweethearts index. Valentine’s Day may seem romantic, but to candy companies, it’s serious business. Our annual ode to St. Valentine is one of the most important and competitive days on candy company calendars, and every year, confectioners roll out special-edition heart-shaped chocolate bars and other product innovations to capture consumers’ dollars (nevermind hearts)....

item.title: Discord is asking for your ID. The backlash is about more than privacy
item.description: Critics say mandatory age verification reflects a deeper shift toward routine identity checks and digital surveillance. Want to use Discord from next month? You’ll have to hand over a photo of your ID or a scan of your face to verify you’re of age. It’s part of a new process introduced by the chat app aimed at ensuring no one underage is using the platform. All new and existing users, the company says, will be given a “teen-appropriate experience” by default, including content filtering and limited access to spaces that host adult content....

item.title: Capital One’s giant LaGuardia Airport restaurant shows how credit card issuers are redefining travel perks
item.description: The Landing at Terminal B is a 12,500-square-foot, chef-driven dining space created with José Andrés. Airport lounges used to be a perk. In 2026, they are a battleground.

item.title: I tested the Philips Hue Essential smart lights, and they blew me away with their budget price and stunning colors
item.description: If you like the idea of smart lighting but you've been put off by the price, the Philips Hue Essential series could be exactly what you need.

item.title: Windows 11 : une faille critique dans le Bloc-notes corrigée par la dernière mise à jour
item.description: Les récents efforts de modernisation du Bloc-notes par Microsoft ont provoqué une faille de sécurité critique qui vient heureusement d'être corrigée.

item.title: Un serveur IA = 6700 PC portables : voici pourquoi le prix des PC va exploser en 2026
item.description: La demande de l'IA engloutit quasiment toute l'offre RAM du marché en 2026. Le constructeur Acer livre des éléments de comparaison utiles pour mieux comprendre la pénurie.

item.title: How to watch Australia vs. Zimbabwe online for free
item.description: How to watch T20 World Cup for free. Live stream Australia vs. Zimbabwe in the 2026 T20 World Cup for free from anywhere in the world.

item.title: Barely any EU data centers are actually ready for AI - and upgrading could be a costly challenge
item.description: Europe's existing data centers aren't ready for AI – upgrading them is challenging, and new built-outs are slow.

item.title: Quels sont les meilleurs disques durs externes (SSD, HDD) ?
item.description: Un disque dur externe est la façon la plus simple et la plus sûre de sauvegarder ses données. Mais que choisir entre un SSD et un disque dur à plateaux ? Voici nos conseils pour bien choisir le vôtre, ainsi que notre sélection des meilleurs disques durs externes SSD et HDD disponibles sur le marché.

item.title: Oups, Xiaomi lance par erreur sa réponse à l’Apple AirTag
item.description: Dans la gigantesque panoplie de produits Xiaomi, le géant chinois ne proposait toujours pas le badge de géolocalisation. C'est fait, face à l'Apple AirTag, voici le Xiaomi Tag.

item.title: Mi-picoprojecteur, mi-veilleuse, le surprenant Yaber T1 Pro chute sous les 160 € avec cette promo
item.description: Il peut être trimballé partout, projeter des images en Full HD sur le plafond et les calibrer tout seul comme un grand : voici le Yaber T1 Pro, un picoprojecteur élégant bourré de qualités. Actuellement, Amazon le propose à 159,99 euros au lieu de 249,99 euros.

item.title: Google Photos pourrait enfin proposer l’option de partage qu’on attendait tous
item.description: Google Photos teste un nouveau bouton « Copier » qui va enfin permettre de partager des images facilement, quelle que soit l’application.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S26, S26 Plus et S26 Ultra : voici chaque coloris de chaque modèle
item.description: L'intégralité des coloris des Samsung Galaxy S26, Galaxy S26 Plus et Galaxy S26 Ultra se montre déjà en ligne.

item.title: Memory chip stocks: Why Micron and Sandisk are soaring today as shortage fuels global RAM demand
item.description: Companies that make memory chips have seen their share prices skyrocket over the last year. Investors received even more good news this week. This morning, shares of two of the largest computer memory companies that trade on U.S. markets are up yet again.

item.title: Moins de 10 minutes pour charger sa voiture électrique en Europe : les détails des bornes Xpeng se précisent
item.description: Xpeng prévoit de déployer ses bornes de charge rapide capables de délivrer jusqu’à 1 000 kW en Europe, de quoi recharger les voitures électriques compatibles en moins de 10 minutes. Les premières stations apparaîtront dès 2026.

item.title: Here’s What It’s Like to Use TurboTax’s Mobile App to File Taxes on Your Own (2026)
item.description: Sigh. Another tax season is upon us. I filed my taxes with TurboTax, exploring its newest features and free or low-cost filing options.

item.title: The Best Kindle Accessories (2026): Cases, Page Turners, Stickers
item.description: Looking to better protect your Kindle or add a little personality to your favorite e-reader? From cases and covers to page turners and even charms, this is the guide for you.

item.title: Get Elevation Lab's 10-year extended battery case for AirTag for only $16 for Presidents' Day
item.description: AirTags are basically an essential accessory for iPhone users who want to keep track of things like their keys, wallet and backpack. While it's easy enough to replace the battery in both versions of the AirTag, you may not want to have to rush to do so at the end of the battery's roughly two-year lifespan. That's where Elevation Lab's extended battery case for the AirTag comes in, and it's heavily discounted right now: it's 30 percent off and down to $16. The case usually sells for $23, so that's a 30 percent discount. It's not the first time we've seen this deal, but it's a pretty decent one ...

item.title: I found one of the biggest price cuts on a brand new Core Ultra 7 Dell laptop - this Dell 14 Plus is now under $700 for Presidents' Day
item.description: Dell Presidents' Day sale knocks $520 off the Dell 14 Plus – one of the biggest price cuts I’ve seen on a brand new Ultra 7 machine.

item.title: Steam Deck : est-ce le bon moment d’acheter avant une possible hausse des prix ?
item.description: Si vous aviez dans l'idée d'acheter un Steam Deck, maintenant semble le meilleur moment pour se faire plaisir. Qui sait si la console portable sera disponible encore longtemps aux prix actuels : les stocks sont vides en Amérique du Nord, et rien ne dit que Valve regarnisse les linéaires bientôt — et si c'est le cas, le danger est qu'une hausse de tarifs vienne compromettre l'excellent rapport qualité/prix de l'appareil....

item.title: AI malware, Gemini lures and more: Google reveals how hackers are actually using AI
item.description: Google's Threat Intelligence Group finds attackers are getting up to some seriously interesting stuff using AI.

item.title: 22,912 pounds of raw ground beef recalled: E. coli contamination fears at food service locations
item.description: The USDA has labeled the recalled products as high risk, with the potential to cause adverse health consequences or even death. Here’s what to know. An Idaho-based beef processing facility is recalling about 22,912 pounds of raw ground beef over concerns that the products might be contaminated with E. coli O145.

item.title: MasterClass deal: Get half off subscriptions ahead of Presidents' Day
item.description: MasterClass is offering 50 percent off its annual memberships right now, cutting the cost of its plans in half for a limited time. That brings the Premium tier down to $10 per month when billed yearly, while the Plus and Standard plans are also discounted to $8 monthly and $5 monthly, respectively. Each tier unlocks the full catalog of classes, with the main differences coming down to how many devices can stream at once and whether offline viewing is included. There are more than 200 classes on MasterClass now, and many are led by big names at the top of their fields. Depending on your interes...

item.title: 'That sounds like problematic use': You're not addicted to Instagram, says its boss – you're just 'binging' it like a Netflix show
item.description: Opening statements have been heard as social media platforms go on trial for causing mental health issues.

item.title: One More ‘Stranger Things’ Actor Wants You to Give Up on ‘Conformity Gate’
item.description: Caleb McLaughlin shares his thoughts on how fans reacted to the ending of 'Stranger Things.'

item.title: Crypto-Funded Human Trafficking Is Exploding
item.description: The use of cryptocurrency in sales of human beings for prostitution and scam compounds nearly doubled in 2025, according to a conservative estimate. Many of the deals are happening in plain sight.

item.title: KitchenAid has revealed its official color of 2026, and it's the breath of minty freshness your kitchen needs this spring
item.description: Spearmint is a refreshing shade of green with a sandy finish, and it's like licking a mint choc chip ice cream at the beach on a warm summer's day.

item.title: ‘We have to learn to embrace the imperfect nature of human solutions…’ — what we lose when AI starts doing all our thinking at work
item.description: AI tools promise easier work, but some experts warn they may also be eroding our sense of challenge, agency, and meaning.

item.title: This $7,999 robot will fold (some of) your laundry
item.description: If you have a spare $7,999 (plus a $250 deposit), hate folding laundry, and happen to live in the Bay Area, one-and-a-half-year-old startup Weave has the robot for you: Isaac 0. It takes Isaac 0 around 30-90 minutes to fold a load of laundry, Weave says. That's all it does - it's stationary and needs […]

item.title: Apple's Siri relaunch is reportedly behind schedule
item.description: Apple’s long-delayed AI-powered Siri redesign may not be rolling out this year, at least in the way the company had planned. According to Bloomberg’s Mark Gurman, Apple found problems with its software upon testing, such as the virtual assistant taking too long to accomplish tasks or even not processing queries properly altogether. Siri’s new version was also reportedly so sluggish during testing that its developers believed Apple would have to push back its launch by months. Instead of releasing the redesigned assistant in March as was previously reported, Gurman says Apple will roll out its ...
